intro: Tephroseris wagneri, commonly known as Wagner's tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It has small, narrow leaves and is often found in dry, coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
